title: HR Reporting & Data Integration Analyst
description: <strong>Discover. A brighter future.</strong><p><br></p>With us, you’ll do meaningful work from Day 1. Our collaborative culture is built on three core behaviors: We Play to Win, We Get Better Every Day &amp; We Succeed Together. And we mean it — we want you to grow and make a difference at one of the world's leading digital banking and payments companies. We value what makes you unique so that you have an opportunity to shine.<p><br></p>Come build your future, while being the reason millions of people find a brighter financial future with Discover.<p><br></p><strong>Job Description:</strong><p><br></p>In this role, you will join a fast-paced Human Resources analytics team as an HR Reporting &amp; Data Integration Analyst and serve as the Workday HCM data and reporting subject matter expert. This experienced candidate will have strong expertise in developing and maintaining simple to complex reports and dashboards specifically but not limited to matrix, composite, scorecards, and analytical indicators utilizing Workday’s report writer as well as other tools and available technologies. You will be an expert in building and maintaining complex calculated fields and have a solid understanding of the relationships within Workday’s Business Objects. In addition, this role will also support other areas of HR reporting including Tableau developed reports and dashboards from a data quality perspective, as well as data migration and transformation into our cloud environment. This role will be a liaison to Business Technology to support new and existing data from Workday to our data warehouse for continued use in advanced reporting and analytics development. As a Lead Reporting &amp; Analytics Developer, you will also be responsible for understanding and supporting data stewardship initiatives and the importance of security for all HR data the team manages. A successful team member will be extremely detail orientated, flexible with continuous process / system changes and comprehend the abilities and limitations from a reporting perspective.<p><br></p>Responsible for creating reporting solutions and partnering with technology teams to manage Human Resources data and reporting technologies. Designs and develops analyses on the employee population, including demographic profiles, turnover ratios, activity reports, and recruitment data. Partners with internal clients to address reporting needs. Actively manages and escalates risk and customer-impacting issues within the day-to-day role to management.<p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Creates report solutions</li><li>Consults with internal clients on the development of analytics including: needs assessments, programming, and delivery of report solutions.</li><li>Identifies, troubleshoots, and validates data discrepancies between data sources. Provides solutions to improve accuracy and usability of data.</li><li>Develops self service tools that enable users to interact with data sets, process data, and generate reports.</li><li>Utilizes tools and automation to satisfy key compliance data requirements.</li><li>Manages HR data warehouse architecture in partnership with technology team.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Minimum Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><strong>At a minimum, here’s what we need from you:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor's Degree in Information Technology, Analytics, Statistics or related field </li><li>2+ years of experience in Reporting, analytics, relational and multi-dimensional databases, report writing software, internal client requirements, developing data-driven solutions, report building, HRIS systems or related</li><li>In lieu of a degree, 6+ years of experience in HR Analytics and reporting </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Preferred Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><strong>If we had our say, we’d also look for:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Prior HR experience in a data/analytics/reporting role</li><li>Previous Snowflake or similar data warehouse experience </li><li>Workday Report Writer experience</li><li>An understanding of data stewardship and security for all HR data the team manages</li><li>Strong expertise in developing and maintaining simple to complex reports and dashboards specifically but not limited to matrix, composite, scorecards, and analytical indicators utilizing Workday’s report writer as well as other tools and available technologies</li></ul><p><br></p>#Remote<p><br></p><strong>Compensation:</strong><p><br></p>The base pay for this position generally ranges between $74,000.00 to $124,800.00. Additional incentives may be provided as part of a market competitive total compensation package. Factors, such as but not limited to, geographical location, relevant experience, education, and skill level may impact the pay for this position.<p><br></p><strong><strong><strong>Benefits:</strong></strong></strong><p><br></p>We also offer a range of benefits and programs based on eligibility. These benefits include:<p><br></p><ul><li>Paid Parental Leave</li><li>Paid Time Off</li><li>401(k) Plan</li><li>Medical, Dental, Vision, &amp; Health Savings Account</li><li>STD, Life, LTD and AD&amp;D</li><li>Recognition Program</li><li>Education Assistance</li><li>Commuter Benefits</li><li>Family Support Programs</li><li>Employee Stock Purchase Plan</li></ul><p><br></p>Learn more at MyDiscoverBenefits.com.<p><br></p>What are you waiting for? Apply today!<p><br></p>All Discover employees place our customers at the very center of our work. To deliver on our promises to our customers, each of us contribute every day to a culture that values compliance and risk management.<p><br></p>Discover is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Discover is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veteran status, or other legally protected status. description: We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.<p><br></p>At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.<p><br></p>To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com<p><br></p><strong>Job Description</strong><p><br></p>The Data Governance Analyst supports ongoing critical data identification and definition activities. The incumbent will be responsible for two critical functions: 1) use independent judgement to identify, anticipate and oversee identification of data that is critical to strategic business objectives and 2) execution of data policy and standard requirements for identified critical data elements in partnership with lines of business and functional groups. The ideal candidate will bring a variety of skills, be proactive in solving problems, be able to work independently and part of a team, and be comfortable communicating with many different levels of employees across the organization.<p><br></p><strong>Business Unit Description</strong><p><br></p>The US Data Management Office is responsible for establishing data as a strategic asset for CIBC US Region, further enhancing data governance, building out our data and analytic capabilities, and developing the US Region data management strategy.<p><br></p>Our strategy: Leverage data and analytics to build competitive advantage to enhance our client focus. To facilitate this, we will:<p><br></p><ul><li>Improve our data quality through focused data governance programs and processes</li><li>Use new data technology to increase agility and reduce cost</li><li>Become an analytics leader, focusing on continuous advancement</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Position Responsibilities</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Analyze reporting outputs to trace metrics back to underlying data components and sources to facilitate critical data identification and classification discussions with business Subject Matter Experts</li><li>Coordinate with stakeholders across the business and technology to define critical data including business, technical and operational metadata attributes</li><li>Monitoring, measuring and taking action to address data quality within the US Data Catalog by incorporating and understanding information from a variety of sources to recommend a course of action</li><li>Escalating, managing and reporting critical data identification and definition issues with transparency, as well as effectively creating accountability with those who fail to maintain these standards</li><li>Be informed and engaged as a subject matter expert on data-related regulatory requirements, organizational policies and standards, as well as industry best practices</li><li>Provide appropriate guidance, education, training, and communication to all relevant stakeholders</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>5 years of related work experience in Data Governance</li><li>Broad and comprehensive skills</li><li>Ability to prioritize and handle multiple tasks in a fast-paced environment with attention to detail and accuracy</li><li>Confidence to work directly with all levels of management and facilitate meetings</li><li>Excellent communication skills - both verbally and written</li><li>Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Excel, PowerPoint and Word) and SharePoint</li><li>Ability to work description: CNH Industrial is a world-class equipment and services company dedicated to advancing the noble work of agriculture and construction workers. Driven by our shared purpose of Breaking New Ground, we are passionate about bringing Innovation, Sustainability, and Productivity to all that we do. As a truly global company, CNH Industrial's 37,000+ employees form part of a diverse and inclusive workplace, focused on empowering customers to grow, and build, a better world through our core brands: Case IH, STEYR, New Holland Agriculture, CASE, and New Holland Construction.<p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities</strong><p><br></p>Duties: The Display Systems Engineer at CNH Industrial America LLC in Burr Ridge, Illinois will be responsible for driving the timely, efficient, and cost-effective design of agriculture and construction equipment display and cluster products. Develop requirements and associated system architecture, system designs, test cases, and acceptance criteria. Interface with the Vehicle Integration Engineers to ensure that the displays are successfully integrated into the target vehicle electrical systems. Harmonize the UI/UX HMI designs with the display component software design. Work with the Safety Engineers to fulfill the necessary Functional Safety requirements (ISO25119). Work with the Network Architecture team to ensure that the displays and clusters meet all applicable protocol standards and performance requirements. Troubleshoot problems and develop root cause through hardware and software failure analysis and testing. Support plants, suppliers, and customers with resolving issues. Support the Project Manager(s) with System Engineering estimates and resource planning. Actively assisting the Project Manager with managing external supplier(s) to ensure that their deliverables meet the project requirements and overall project needs. Aid Project Managers with resource planning. Develop future roadmaps to maximize design commonality for display and cluster products across all vehicle product lines. Salary: $134,120-156,000/year.<p><br></p><strong>Qualifications</strong><p><br></p>Minimum Requirements: Requires a Bachelor’s degree in Electronics Engineering or directly related field plus five years of experience in product development and developing displays for automotive or commercial vehicles. This individual will be responsible for monitoring the real-time operation of our systems, responding to outages, developing tools to manage an ever-increasing range of systems, and working closely with software and hardware engineers, as well traders and quants, to identify issues and build better systems.<p><br></p><strong>What You'll Do:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Use existing monitoring tools to monitor systems for problems and performance, and to have primary responsibility to answer questions and handle outages. </li><li>Use SQL to configure systems and to analyze data from multiple sources to contribute to a larger picture of system performance</li><li>Work with developers to deploy new servers and applications, reconfigure existing systems, and track changes made to the system. </li><li>Work with the IT group to procure, test, and configure production and test hardware, track changes, and plan for future system needs. </li><li>Work to automate existing procedures and work with developers to analyze and improve systems to address support problems and increase system transparency. </li><li>Work with developers and analysts to configure, test, and validate new strategies and deployments. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>What We're Looking For:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>At least 2 years of experience in any industry</li><li>Desire to work and be exposed to a diverse range of DevOps related skills and problems, including getting into the finer details of topics and gaining in-depth domain knowledge </li><li>Effective and clear communication skills, including being able to talk and relay concepts to peers and team members of varying technical ability </li><li>Overall drive to own and solve time-sensitive problems in the context of a team environment, actively pushing to move towards resolutions in the most efficient and concise way possible</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Bonus Points:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Experience working in the trading industry, including a working knowledge of exchange protocols and order lifecycles </li><li>General operations knowledge including, but not limited to:</li><li>Working with TCP and relevant networking tools, such as Wireshark and tcpdump</li><li>Linux systems and OS level configurations</li><li>General server management / infrastructure </li></ul><p><br></p><em>Why Wolverine? </em><p><br></p>It's not about the clothes... it's about the person in them. At Wolverine, we've created a strong, collaborative environment with exceptional growth opportunities. Whether your interest is trading, technology, or operations, motivated and innovative individuals can find many pathways to success.<p><br></p><strong>Wolverine Culture:</strong><p><br></p>Our flat organizational structure promotes teamwork across the Firm and offers easy access to senior staff (don't worry, they won't be wearing a suit either). While we work exceptionally well as a team in the office, our bonds are further strengthened through company events, activities and giving back. Volleyball, soccer, hockey, 5K runs, picnic, parties, and trivia nights provide friendly competition and build better relationships. By getting out of our usual environment and doing out-of-the-ordinary things together, we foster creativity and broaden our imaginations to accomplish new challenges.<p><br></p><strong>Wolverine Benefits: </strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Highly competitive salary bonus</li><li> Generous paid time off and flexible scheduling</li><li> 100% coverage of medical, dental, vision, life, and disability benefits for single coverage</li><li> Generous Paid Parental Leave</li><li> Retirement Plans: 401K and Roth 401K</li><li> Profit sharing plan</li><li> Long- and short-term disability</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Perks of being at Wolverine:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Casual dress</li><li> Free breakfast and lunch from our in-house kitchen with rotating menus (including snacks!)</li><li> On-site gym with a subsidized membership</li><li> Frequent company outings</li><li> Opportunity to give back to organizations that help individuals in need, improve public health and provide others with educational opportunities and resources.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Professional Development </strong><p><br></p><ul><li> In-house education team – educational classes and resources are offered by our education team for continuous learning opportunities</li><li> Mentorship Program</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>What to expect for our interview process:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Resume Review</li><li> Assessment</li><li> Phone Screen</li><li> Team Interview Series</li><li> Decision</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>About Wolverine</strong><p><br></p>Founded in 1994, the Wolverine companies comprise a number of diversified financial institutions specializing in proprietary trading, asset management, order execution services, and technology solutions. We are recognized as a market leader in derivatives valuation, trading, and value-added order execution across global equity, options, and futures markets. With a focus on innovation, achievement, and integrity, we take pride in serving the interests of both our clients and colleagues. The Wolverine companies are headquartered in Chicago with offices in New York and San Francisco and a proprietary trading affiliate office located in London.
